saves.title: Nov. 30, 2015 — Pictures of the Day
saves.abstract: Photos from France, Greece, India and China.

saves.title: Dr. Oliver Sacks, Explorer of the Brain
saves.abstract: Dr. Oliver Sacks was a neurologist and best-selling author who explored the brain’s strangest pathways. His work touched Hollywood, theater, even opera, and his legacy lasts in the stories he told.

related_urls.suggested_link_text: Oliver Sacks, Neurologist Who Wrote About the Brain’s Quirks, Dies at 82
Oliver Sacks, Casting Light on the Interconnectedness of Life

multimedia.caption: Oliver Sacks in 1995. In describing his patients’ struggles and sometimes uncanny gifts, Dr. Sacks helped introduce syndromes like Tourette’s or Asperger’s to a general audience.

saves.title: The Collateral Victims of Criminal Justice
saves.abstract: An arrest, whether or not a conviction follows, has long-term consequences for a defendant’s family.

multimedia.caption: Markeisha Brown, 25, had to drop out of school when her children’s caretaker was held on bail he couldn’t afford for a case that was later dropped.
multimedia.copyright: Jonathan Hanson for The New York Times
